text: the only reason i'm rating 3 stars is solely because i love the wings here. everything else is bad! bad food, bad service unless you are in the bar area. our waitress was so awkward!! she would walk past our table, stare and not say a thing. i told her i didn't like my lettuce wraps and she took them away, then brought me my check with them on there, she wanted to charge me for them. what the hell? i made her take them off. my salad was literally hot because they put the hot chicken over it and it made it soggy. literally one of my worst experiences at a restaurant.

i had a grubhub order from here. a large plate for 3 people. the chow mein was great as was the 2 orders of orange chicken. the 3rd was broccoli beef. it was so bad. the broccoli tasted rancid and there was only 1 piece of beef smaller than my pinky finger. i will never order that from here, ever again. nor do i recommend anyone else order the broccoli beef. worst. thing. ever!!!

devastation! that's the only word that currently comes to mind when i think of el torero. every weekend i head to el torero with my family for our favorite mexican food fix. just the other day we excitedly walked up to the front door to stumble across a horrific sign.....closed/for sale.  what?!?!? this can't be happening. our favorite mexican food restaurant in all of tucson is closing and for sale!?!? this is a complete catastrophe. what are we going to do now? i am really going to miss you, el torero, and i'm especially going to miss my favorite waitress shorty and the best (i mean best) cheese enchiladas and ground beef tacos in the world.  this family run business has been serving authentic mexican food for years and was one of a kind! i've been going to el torero with my family since i was a little kid. it was our weekend tradition and one that will never be forgotten. thanks for all the great memories, food, and fun el torero.
everything wonderful, except 1 pound costillas carnitas style, complete bad flavor, i put in the trash, i can't eating. $7.99 x pound. chicharrón botanero espectacular.

absolutely the rudest person and worst service... my husband and i came here for a nice lunch and were treated horribly by evi ( had to get her name i was shaking so bad) .... will never step foot back here ....the owners need to do something, our first impression was awful.  as small business owners in town we understand that people like this can ruin your quality of care of service. follow up .... owner came out and apologized and took care of us from then on which is why i bumped my 1 star to 3 ... food very flavorful

this place smells horrible!  i was forewarned but it's near work and omw home.  i was really craving bread and tuscana.  i also love the calamari here but i think it's losing it's zing for me.  i sat at the bar since i was alone.  the bar staff was friendly but i never got any names, my food came out expediently and i spent about an hour there today.  i don't think i'll return though because it really does smell bad in this joint... like a dumpster

i think this place has a lot of potential but the customer service was the worst i have ever seen. i have never left a bad review and i'm too kind to even put one star which is what i would truly rate this place. i had a few people ask me about this place and i simply told them your experience might be better but they don't want to go now. no so epic is how i would describe it. nevertheless i hope they work it out and i wish them all the best. my suggestion hire grant cardone.

delicious wings. crispy and great sauce.  service is horrible. our waitress never came and ask how we doing, no refill. they also prepared my order wrong, gave me the wrong flavor of wings. (they are still delicious tho)  the restaurant is disgusting, flies flying around. tables are dirty.  i will only get to go from now on.

this establishment is the absolute worst place i have ever been. a few friends and i went there on saturday nov. 29th to karaoke and have some dinner. the food was just nasty and not worth the money. as far as the karaoke went, we were enjoying ourselves when this drunk obnoxious idiot named derrick got up and very loudly screamed out a song and it was very offensive. it included the f--k word numerous times. he was about 21. not cool. then we found out thst this punk was the manager!!! he showed no respect for anyone else there. then he got more drunk. when we complained to the owner he said "he's just having fun". like he condones this kind of thing!! ridiculous!! then the owner accused us of not buying anything and told us to take our business elsewhere! we all bought dinner!!! this place is definately not worth your time and the food sucks! i would not recommend this place to anyone unless you like drunk punks who think they are all that. don't bother. they could care less!! when i tried to post this it wouldn't let me unless i chose a star rating. i tried to give one star so i could post this. it highlighted all the stars!!! i didn't want to give them any stars. they suck!!!!!
it's an overpriced denny's! big line, poor service, and bad management! staff is overwhelmed, anxious and with no apparent training! it's a shame.

i'm so disappointed  the food was awful .. probably what i ordered .. eggs benedict with cauliflower mush underneath & the service was the worst ever!!! i had to beg for coffee then was ignored ‍it was a birthdayparty & they never cleaned up the brunch dishes .. so we are sitting there trying to open gifts around dirty dishes.. for a sunday morning it wasn't busy .. now i know why! so sorry but i think for the $$ they could do a whole lot better!! i won't be going back for brunch .. i would have rather ordered off the regular menu but was never asked or i never thought of asking... save your $$ & go to 1st watch or baja cafe!! for sunday brunch!

got a gift certificate for this ham place. the ham was actually extremely tasty, although very expensive, which didn't matter, since it was covered by the gift certificate. but since i had some left over balance on the gift card i purchased 6 side dishes, the potatoes au gratin, the broccholi casserole, the beans and the apple cinnamon desert. i must say that all the side dishes were absolutely horrible. i will go back to the store to get another ham, should i ever get another gift certificate, but i will never ever get these sides dishes again, not even if they were free of charge.

my husband bought a prickly pear cupcake for me for $5.50. i was so excited to eat it since i love cupcakes and i have celiac's disease. the cake was exquisite but the frosting, my favorite part, was hands down the worst frosting that i've ever had. it tasted like sweet crisco. it was so bad and left a coating on the roof of my mouth. i couldn't even swallow it, i had to spit it out. i will make my own cupcakes from now on.

worst place ever. my family had gone for a dinner party and the service was horrible, our food took hours to even get to us. they didn't know who's order went with who, management was no help either. we were still being brought our orders as we were getting up ready to leave. overpriced every single order in the dinner party. my waitress was miserable and letting it show. i will never again be returning here. first and last time.   h
had my shabbat dinner with a friend a couple weeks ago. a piece of ny steak, broccoli and some bread. got the worst food poisoning ever.

justin has to be the worst waiter ever! i was mis- treated by his rude comments before, not worth repeating his diminutive remarks. another star because he did not honor my request to be served by another waiter or talk to management. asking for the manager/cook/owner is like looking for gold, never available hiring a creep like this does nit say much for him either. the food is good but the lack of service is a repeated complaint in this establishment.

updating my review... dropping a star because of numerous bad experiences during pandemic with take out.  skimpy servings and just poor preparation.   i have not had sit down service, but i'm hopeful that the in restaurant experience is like it was.  but i cannot recommend for any takeout.

oh dear!  we've now got to la prices without the food, service or sophistication to warrant such prices.  what started out as a very good bistro type restaurant, with appropiate pricing, has suddenly taken on amusing airs and graces.  food now seems less important than patrons' posing; service seems less important than being cool; keeping reservations seems less important than overbooking. as an award, this restaurant has the worst service, bar none.  this writer's companion wrote to the owners just after opening pointing out the problems with the service.  she received no response.  i guess they don't care or understand because on each subsequent visit things only got worse.

amazing food. horrific service. idk if too many tables or someone called out sick.passive aggressive waitress. completely forgotten for dinner. would come back for takeout but service is so sad and takes away from the food.

terrible coffee,  underwhelming food, adequate service.   appetizer plate was super greasy, and along the lines of low quality microwaveable foods.  coffee was stale, and luke warm.  its ihop... what on earth were you expecting?
food was delicious but a bit over priced in my opinion. i wouldnt go regularly but maybe every once in awhile.

food and atmosphere are great but the food took a little while, you have to pay for parking around there and the waitress was a little slow. if you don't mind paying for parking and aren't in a hurry definitely recommend

bing's is pretty good but a little bit inconsistent with the thai tea. sometimes, it'll be extra sweet and at times, they're a bit bland. i know that they can make it more sweet if need be, but i have no idea before i order it how they will make it, sweet or not so that's a bit hard for me.
meatballs were a little over cooked and the bread could use just a little more attention, but the food was delicious.

i've been here for happy hour and bar food a few times and though i like the atmosphere and the drinks, the food is just not that good. usually janos's restaurants are worth the splurge, but the times i've ordered food here i just haven't been impressed, so for a discount at happy hour it's a great option but otherwise i'm just not excited to spend a good dinner's night out here. the atmosphere is fun at the tables and for two or three at the bar, but it can be tricky and a little crowded at the bar if you're with a bigger group.
i love how they offer vegan pizza!  but their sauce can sometimes be too acidic for my taste.  i usually feel kind of sick after eating it (too salty?).

i've eaten here many times, and i'm a big fan of the food. however, the service is not great and the atmosphere in the restaurant is not great either. la indita is housed in an old building on 4th ave that probably hasn't been renovated in decades, and it sometimes feels a little stuffy inside. so, if atmosphere is a big deal to you, i wouldn't recommend la indita. if food is all that matters to you, i would definitely recommend la indita. they have excellent chips and salsa, the chicken mole is very good, and the tarascan tacos are super-tasty. =)

good personal pizza, but the crust is a little too burn in some spots. i like my crust extra crispy, but sometimes it's a little too charred at fired pie. the toppings and cheese taste awesome tho. this is like a lot of those build your own pizza places, but these pizzas have a little more uniqueness to them.

our family loved mod but i wish they would cook the pizzas a little bit longer. anytime there is more then about 3 toppings on the pizza, they tend to be under cooked.  we have stuck to just ordering a few toppings and therefore our pizzas have been great but anytime we add more we are disappointed.

i used to love this bar for all the reasons other people have written about, but in the last few months the staff has changed, and many (not all) of the bartenders are not quite as friendly, knowledgeable, and interactive as they used to be. i'm looking for another hangout just in case.
i love their food and bread the atmosphere is a little too hectic and disorganized though so i usually take it home

the sandwich is awesome, but a little overpriced.  they do have a wide selection to choose off the menu, but my selection comes from all the hot students who comes here on the weekend, and that is why it get 5 stars!!!
staff is super friendly but seems to take a long time to get your food. definitely not a place to go in a hurry. but the excellent food and great staff make up for the wait.

i came here for the first time with my roommates. some other friends of mine had me hyped up for this place since it reopened. unfortunately, i did not try the sushi or the korean barbecue so i will have to come back to review those. instead, i ordered tempura udon.  my experience with udon at most places isn't so great. i chatter a lot when i go out to eat with friends so i'm usually a slow eater. halfway through the meal, the udon noodles tend to break apart and slowly dissolve into the soup. this was definitely not the case at takamatsu. i got to socialize and catch up with friends while enjoying udon that remained soft without disintegrating into the broth.
i recommend this business, but every time i go there's something slightly wrong with my order. nice family though!

the food and the baked goods are quite tasty; however, today's register attendee lacked warmth and was not very helpful in assisting us with our order.  in fact, it could be said that she would be better off working at the dmv.
the food is delicious but it can take a while to get service, especially if there are a lot of people coming in to place take-out orders.

just moved back to tucson and i wanted a hot dog and i was a bit disappointed, i don't remember the hot dog being so small from when they first started out. the dog is only about half the size of the bun. it's still tasty but they seemed to have gotten cheap with the dog

i've eaten here twice once dining in and once for takeout the food is always amazing,  i've had the lavish chicken wrap and the salmon plate 4 very good and i would order again. but it feels like there consistently short staffed the food takes a long time to come out and the server seem overworked. whoever is running this place might want to think about adding some more staff.(they may just be running less staff due to covid, but it seems there is enough business to have some one working to go orders, and someone to focus on tables)

the food was just okay. not that awesome in taste. the mist in the outdoor sitting gets in the food when windy and this worried me about getting legionella. i'm a clean freak however so i tend to be hyper-aware of potential germs. i would eat inside next time. cost is on par with most restaurants in the area.

background  north has a number of locations in arizona & texas. i just had lunch at the tucson location. skyline in tucson is a beautiful and north is very pretty. (see pics)  there is an impressive bar, a large dining room with edgy lighting and a cozy patio.  the menu  the menu includes appetizers/small plates, salads, pastas & mains. (see pics) appetizers:  zucca chips braised meatballs calamari bruschetta grilled cauliflower  black mediterranean muscles truffle garlic bread  grilled artichoke  chef's board (which i had - see pics) pastas:  spaghetti & meatballs chicken pesto cheese tortellini bolognese  strozzapreti squid ink malafoine  ricotta gnocchi (which i had) mains:  grilled brazino short ribs diver scallops chicken parmesan roasted chicken ny strip atlantic salamon desserts:  bombolini olive oil cake dark chocolate tart tiramisu affogati gelato salted caramel budino conclusion  5/5 recommend  of note *hours: lunch: 11am - 4pm dinner: 4pm - 9:30pm/10:30pm fri & sat/9 sun happy hour: 3pm - 6pm *for more information: northitaliarestaurant.com
chile rellenos in the tucson area rated according to the homeland security advisory system with three word descriptors. mi tierra: eggy and bland. green see photos.
chile rellenos in the tucson area rated according to the homeland security advisory system with three word descriptors. viva burrito: frozen cheese inside. green see photos.

the company boasts a brewery and a separate bistro location within the city limits.   we drove the ten minutes to the bistro and found ourselves in the middle of a monkey-muraled mishap. not the logo, just the impression it made.  it was everywhere; painted on the building's side in the style of an antiquated graphic stamp, on the floor, on the ceiling and the walls, on our table, in the decor, on the bar, the beers, the bathrooms...cute.  the iconic monkey's impressive coup de main may be the only reason for the continued survival of the business.  the beer isn't bad either, especially the...monkey shine?  monkey--anyone need further elaboration..? we ordered two appetizers to begin:  "nachos nimbus" and "monkey burn."  (menu: http://www.nimbusbeer.com/bistro/bistro%20menu.pdf) the menu brags a delicious description of the "house-made cheese blend" that sits atop the "house-made tortilla chips" of the nimbus nachos.  my question, should a member of the nimbus staff wander across this critique, is: at who's frigg'n house was this food made? i found a comparable "cheese blend" in that handy machine at the corner store.  you know the one; you pulled the lever a couple dozen times at 3am--underage but smashed out of your mind and sick with the munchies.  it is a sauce, a cheese sauce, and whether you open the large bags that hold it all together in the back of a restaurant or the back of a volkswagen, it doesn't belong in a bistro. can i get a "circle k," anybody..?  also, there is avocado, there is salsa, but there was not a drop of the "avocado salsa" mentioned on the menu anywhere on the dish.  there was corn in my salsa, no avocado, and while there may have been chicken on the nachos as ordered--gustavo and i  debated whether the thin slivers of white spread with thrifty sense throughout were meat or, as i posited, "just our imaginations"-- it certainly wasn't enough chicken to merit it as a choice we needed to make while ordering. now, both my man and i have an appreciation for spicy foods.  the eating of them is traditional in his culture and has always been a favorite indulgence of mine.  but "monkey burn"... have you ever had the capsicum annum variety black pearl straight from a botanist's garden?  i have, a good friend of mine grows a few of the hearty plants.  the small pepper, which does indeed resemble a tiny black pearl at its start, packs a wallop that will leave your eyes watering and your mouth begging for a piece of bread. it rates much higher in scoville heat units (shu), coming in at 30,000, than the jalapeño at 2,000-5,000 (google a diagram.) after eating "monkey burn" i'm convinced the chefs at nimbus have learned how to use a chili shaped cake pan to mold, bread and fry police-grade pepper spray. suffice it to say, we took those to go.  after i d'breaded them at home, they were so raw that i stored and used them sparingly in some homemade salsa. the coup de grâce:  it could have been a saving grace, but the bacon mac & cheese
chile rellenos in the tucson area rated according to the homeland security advisory system with three word descriptors. las cazuelitas: no yellow cheese. red   see photos.
georgia chopped pork better than anything i've eaten in georgia.  mmmm.   under $7 for lunch, $9 for a sandwich, and $11 for a dinner platter.
chile rellenos in the tucson area rated according to the homeland security advisory system with three word descriptors. el torero: unstuffed canned chiles. green see photos.
pick 2, fuji apple chicken salad, broccoli and cheese soup with side of potato chips and regular drink. pro tip: dip chips in soup before consuming
chile rellenos in the tucson area rated according to the homeland security advisory system with three word descriptors. guillermo's double l: open since 1948? green see photos.
chile rellenos in the tucson area rated according to the homeland security advisory system with three word descriptors. filiberto's: free meat chunk. green see photos.

a mom and pop mexican dive with a uniquely broad offering of higher end "street food."  mom typically mans the counter and pop mans the stove. we had three different types of tacos:  carnitas; birria, and carne asada.  the carnitas comes like a "smashed" and seared wad of shredded pork; the birria is a juicy fistful of simmered beef; and the carnitas consists chopped steak.  all come heaping with their own garnishments, ranging from corn salsa to tomato/guacamole.  by far, the first two meats were the tastiest (the tiny, cubed carne asada tends to be dry/overdone)  but in all cases you get a hefty portion of protein on the standard-sized (5? inch round) street-style, corn tortillas.  they also came with red and green salsas on the side, which tasted fresh, tangy. pointers:  taco tuesday is a deal at 3/$5.99 for most proteins, including all three above.  all of the above also came with a chipotle-like mayo/sauce already spread onto the taco.  we decided that next time we'd skip the sauce and let the rest of the taco's flavors sing, au natural (less fatty too).  note: to get the taco tuesday special all three tacos must be of the same type. otherwise you'll get charged full price for each individual taco ($3 each +/-)! during covid the dining room is closed.  they are also closed every wednesday but are otherwise  open until 1pm with additional dinner time hours on tu/fr/sa... yes, confusing, so double check :)  ample parking in back (which is also where you circle around to wait after you order at the side drive-through window).

fresh eggs, home-grown greens and grass-fed meats. homemade soaps and  fresh-baked breads.  aroma of coffee roasting on-site fills the air--and if you buy a pound, you get a free cup from scott and denise (www.adventurecoffeeroasting.com) every sunday, 8 a.m. to 12 p.m.
lunch special 11am to 2pm monday- friday $6.99 breakfast special 7am to 11am monday- friday $ 5.98 includes coffee. friday night fish fry (all you can eat) 4pm to 8pm $12.99.

che's lounge may feature offensive odors, patrons of ill-repute, crowds on the weekends, townies, college students, hipsters, construction workers, gringos and mexicanos. detractors will call it a dive bar and fans will call it a 4th ave institution onto itself. if you enjoy bars like this you will probably love che's, if you prefer not to be within arms-reach of people sporting a full set of tattoos you should find another establishment. they also happen to have the cheapest draft on 4th ave - $1.50 miller pints, any time.
happy hour = 1/2 price wine bottles and glasses, 1/2 price draft beers, 1/2 price sides & fries. plain and simple burger is $7.00

since moving to tucson, we've often seen stands with sonoran style hot dogs advertised; such places are often illumined with dim fluorescent lights playing against the smoke of grilling green onions and asada cuts of steak. karamelo king is one such mobile edifice, offering probably the most delicious hotdog i've ever eaten in my life for $2.50. since i'm originally from chicago these may seem like bold words, but everyone we've taken to try this humble trailer's wares is an instant convert. with a standard salsa cart that includes the sliced radishes, cucumbers and 6-7 types of sauce, free grilled onions and a menu that spans the standard burro to the namesake "karamelo" (essentially a quesidilla with juicy steak or chicken within), this spot caters to both midweek legitimate meal stops to 2 am cravings on saturday night. finding it may be tricky, since it resides in the parking lot of a now closed-down auto shop, but if you're heading west on grant, just watch your right side after passing the intersection @ alvernon. it's open every day except sundays, from an indeterminate time in the afternoon to midnight on weekdays, 3 am on fridays and saturdays.
chile rellenos in the tucson area rated according to the homeland security advisory system with three word descriptors. los jilvertos: go somewhere else. green see photos.
i ordered ground beef enchiladas, 20 minutes later they gave me shredded beef. then they remade the order in 2 minutes and half the size of a normal order. stay away.
chile rellenos in the tucson area rated according to the homeland security advisory system with three word descriptors. el potosino: a lazy attempt. green see photos.
chile rellenos in the tucson area rated according to the homeland security advisory system with three word descriptors. maría's: yellow cartoon rat. green see photos.

homely and comfortable place with good service. the country breakfast was way too greasy for my liking. eggs were decent. i like the cinnamon rolls and the jalapeño toast. overall, not a bad place but not a great one either.
nice place friendly buffet ok .not sure about there ribs but chicken and shrimp good .friendly. ladies wait on you good service

service was friendly and quite good, which is the minimum you would expect from an over priced steak house. once in a while the waitress would come by with the table cumber (the metal crumb scraper thingy) to clean the table a bit. that's always a nice touch. the menu was decent in terms of selection. i eat out a lot (way more than i'd like or more than i probably should) and i'm no cheapskate. still, even for me $40+ for just a mediocre steak is a little hard to swallow (figuratively and literally).  and that's just for a plate with a cooked meat of some kind on it. sides? those are extra. if the mean was phenomenal, then i wouldn't bat an eye... we all decide to go with the combo meals (aka pre fixe menu) rather than order everything a-la-carte.  we sent back the bisque because it was way to salty. the steaks came out ok, but they were not really rubbed or seasoned from what i could tell. at the risk of sounding immodest, i prepare a much better steak on the grill at home. a nice rub, some simple salt and pepper, after cooking let sit a few minutes with little bit of butter melted on top. anyway, i ordered the salmon. it was cooked perfectly and tasted very good. i tasked the steak and it was just, meh. also, the inside could use a really good cleaning. the floor coming/going from the kitchen area into the main dining hall is well worn and grimy looking. it's not super well lighted (like most fancy steak houses) so i did not really check out the rest of the place for wear and tear.  i don't know - maybe it's must me - but if i'm dropping a couple hundred dollars on dinner, i expect a little more attention to detail and better food.

we went here last night. the cowboy waiter was cute and attentive. blue corn muffins had a good flavor, but seemed rather hard. got the quesadilla appetizer, half of which was scorched pretty good, but all a good flavor to it. we all tried each other's entree, the salmon was very good, the chicken was to die for. the pot roast was way too salty. tender, vegetables were good, but in the end, i couldn't keep eating it. my husband tasted it and said, oh dinty moore.. i got the apple blossom for dessert, whilst it was good, i expected more caramel flavor to it. my husband got the red ale, which he said was good. we might go back to try the all you can eat ribs. all in all, pleasant, other then my too salty put roast

went here for breakfast today before a hair appointment. was happy to see a sign that said they now offer home fries. i am not a fan of hashbrowns. this is a seat yourself place, and coffee and iced water are served immediately, if you so choose. i do. i ordered scrambled eggs, bacon and homefries. the eggs were fine, a bit dry, but still soft and not overcooked. the bacon was really crispy, which is always good. the homefries appear to have been deep-fried instead of being cooked on a flat-top, but the inclusion of peppers and onions worked. you will need to add salt and pepper right off the bat, but service is friendly and attentive. not as inexpensive as you might expect, but my fave meal is breakfast cooked by someone other than me, with a bunch of coffee. i've had way worse. overall, an ok experience.
vanilla cupcakes were just alright. nice ladies working in there. frosting was good, cake was a muffin. won't be returning.

food was pretty good here. particularly liked the complimentary salsa, better than most places. service was shiesty! at first it wasn't even that bad. but about halfway through the meal our waitress disappeared. she'd occasionally re-appear, but never by our table. we needed two tortillas and some re-fills. my brother ultimately walked up to the counter and politely asked.  about twenty minutes later the other waitress came by and helped us out. she took off one of the meals of the tab, which was sweet.  i agree with other posters that one stop should be enough.

service was great, everything we requested we received in a timely manner. okay chips and salsa. we ordered the chile relleno , chicken fajitas and the burger. first off, no way best burger in town, not even close. the other dishes okay but nothing special, had much better other places. but it was fresh and somewhat tasty.

went here on monday night. ambiance is ok, pretty nice for an amtrak station. the beer selection isn't good - but they have a few decent taps. food is good, not spectacular. oh, and it's expensive. beer is $5-6 a pint, not terrible, though. overall a decent time but not a landmark.
the staff is friendly and it seems to be fairly clean, the decor is nice. as for the food i can definitely say that i have had worse but also better. it is ok but not sure if i will return.

not bad.  we tried the appetizer sampler, there wasn't as much food as i thought but it was good.  we tried the lo mein (beef, chicken and shrimp) which i really enjoyed.  we also tried the dragon and phoenix plate (i think that's what it was called)  and wasn't too impressed.  it was good but i expected more.  overall, it was a good experience, good service and nice atmosphere (no one else there).  it wasn't the best chinese restaurant we've been to, but i'd rank it somewhere in the middle.
a good deli. had a chicago dog. great meats selection, need to return for sandwiches next. boars head
recently has veal piccatta and it was quite good. husband had veal marsala and it was even better. a friendly neighborhood restaurant that has good food.
food was ok. great grilled vegetables. "queso" tasted like melted velveeta. carne asada with no tortillas? nice server but didn't know much about mexican food. good service, though.

service was good. place had a nice environment, it is clean, and the restrooms were also neat and clean.  it was around 2 pm when i visited this place and they were serving brunch. i wasn't too impressed with their brunch menu, i had the pulled pork nachos. the pulled pork meat was more like diced pieces than a shredded meat that i was expecting, it was an alright taste. the cob chicken salad was fresh and the dressing was tasty, the meat loaf was alright. they do have good mimosas!  i may come back for the lunch or dinner menu, and check it out.

i grew up on brooklyn italian food and the food here was a decent attempt.  liked the way the first half of the restaurant was decorated with the gingham red tablecloth, made it feel authentic.  back area blah. was there for lunch and had the chicken piccata lunch special.  my bad, should have told them not to use no butter, just olive oil.  just ok.  salad bar uninspiring, but minestrone soup was good, so was the service.
the owner made a good point for my original post so i'll amend it here. not particularly child friendly. sigh.
ok, finally tried a sweet with their signature turtle custard and it tasted good enough, though i have had better elsewhere.

nice corner family restaurant. the ambiance isn't bad. southwest feel with plenty of televisions so you won't miss the game because your out with the family.  the food is ok. general american fair. most dishes do have a pre prepped by us foods feel.  the staff is friendly and for the most part attentive. the prices could come down as the food is not seller.  we've come several times as my daughters like the kids menu and the drawing paper and crayons.
food was ok, prices are reasonable.  they did not accept the yelp coupon, but offered a military discount.

perfecto mexican normally exceeds my expect-tastin's my friend, we back for more tacos tacos tacos, going locos for them tacos! uno - delicioso muy bueno! dos - local fresh ingredients and arizona beef and sustainable seafood!  tres - hand-made tortillas!  cuatro - convivial outdoors! good table spacing for covid! cinco - excellent service! seis - great value for quality! siete - covid protocol needs better social distancing at the order-up line!!! ocho - mi favorito es pork porque carne and pescado todas esta buenos! nueve - salsa yum yum oh chico! diez - loca en la cabeza para seis tacos! hold the fire - seis serving having an off day. our taco platters and refried beans barely warm - cold - and i like it hot - don't you? that's why i went 3 star today. we'll still be back but make sure tacos hot before server checks out!

no i'm good ! your fronting on philly dog ! tomato on a cheese steak is a sin ! no amorosa rolls even if you have to ship them in ! forget bout it ! real south philly here bro ! jim's, johns, max's, chinks,etc... i could go on forever ! its pork roll man ! taylor ham is pure garbage ! case's, trenton pork roll, even thumans and or loefflers before taylor dude ! seven bucks for a pork roll sandwich ! crazy as hell ! nine bucks for some wings ! lol ! avoid this joint at all cost ! your better of eating nasty ass subway ! fugazi fuckery at this joint !

holy sodium!  everything would have been heavenly had it not been for the fact that i had to drink endless water to avoid dying of dehydration. skip the salt and you're a godsend also your location sucks.  i know at least 50 people who tried to order through doordash and you're out of the area.   you are so capable of blowing up and being so amazingly successful.   think about it.

this could of easily be a 5 star review don't get me wrong. i am obsessed with teaholic! the teas are authentic, flavorful and they use real fruit for the fruit teas. toppings are made fresh and are delicious! the owner is absolutely a doll and welcoming.  why it is not 5 stars. the past two weeks one of their staff member were just flat out rude, wasn't helpful nor welcoming at all. my husband and i consider ourselves as regulars (we are obsessed) but this nasty service gotta stop! to the point where we just don't want to stop by anyone.  we wish this establishment the best! give it a shot, the drinks are amazing.

this review is for the lakeside spa and fitness center only! the resort is the best i've ever stayed at, with the best customer service i've ever had! the young woman at the front desk check in at the resort was incredible and changed my room to one right off the lobby with the  best views. alex with poolside service was amazing. timothy at the concierge was incredible and helpful  and so was in room dining. this review needs to focus on the spa. it was the worst spa experience i have ever had hands-down. from the moment i walked in the older lady behind the counter looked annoyed to even be there. she got my name incorrect twice, didn't ask me to fill out the pertinent paperwork, then asked me if i knew where i was going and when i said no she said oh fine i'll have to show you then. at which point she handed me a robe to put on that smelled so foul i could tell it had not been washed. so she took me to the locker room and upon entering ignored me and started helping another guest whom couldn't figure out their locker. then she just walked out with me standing there. another client was standing there and had to talk me through how to do the locker. so when i was finished with that i changed my disgusting dirty robe out for a clean one that was in the locker. now for the massage. it was the most unprofessional inappropriate experience i have had to date. my massage therapist told me in detail about many things in her past that i would not be comfortable telling my own family. it was so awkward i didn't know how to get out of the conversation and she just kept going into detail about very private things. i cannot imagine why she would ever think it was ok to tell a complete stranger these things, nonetheless someone that she is giving a service to. after the 55 minutes of pure awkwardness, i went into the locker room to shower. when i stepped into the shower there were clumps of hair in the drain that were quite noticeable. it is so amazing that this bad of service is connected with the resort, because the resort is an absolute shining beacon. it makes me wonder if the spa is independently ran and owned? because they cannot have the same person over seeing it. if they do, something must be done at the spa, and if they don't, the person that runs and manages  has to be fired and replaced. i am still shuddering. i can't bring myself to name my massage therapist. as a person she seemed sweet but desperate to have someone listen to her unfortunate past. the types of details she told me belong in a mental health therapists office, not. a massage therapy setting and never being told to the client whom is a captive audience. please use this as a teachable moment with the spa staff. i am still uncomfortable thinking about it. .

do not let this restaurant cater your party!!! i recently had a cinco de mayo birthday party that was for 30+ people.  i had ordered approximately $250 in food 5 days before the event.  i called on the morning of the event and was assured that everything would be perfect.  when almost an hour had passed and the food had still not arrived, i called the restaurant manager.  i was given every excuse under the sun including that they had never received my order.  however suddenly they miraculously found my order and told me it would be 45 more minutes.  i sent two of my guests to get the order instead and the food was "only" 1 1/2 hrs late.  this was a very important party for me and thankfully everyone was having such a great time that it wasn't disastrous, but it very well could have been!  i spent a lot of money on the party and the manager didn't take a penny off the bill even though he totally screwed up the order!  i personally feel that because it was close to mother's day, they got slammed at the restaurant and he just totally blew my order off!  i will never ever go to this restaurant again and certainly will never rely on them to cater a party for me!

we are going to eat their again to celebrate my graduation from radiation treatments.  i am going to be a breast cancer survivor!! the service , the food, and the atmosphere is wonderful! this has become my favorite place to eat!! so i would suggest to all my friends and anyone else reading this -  go their and have a wonder meal!

i feel a little weird/sad as i post these mere three stars because honestly, these noodle soups are the best i've ever had! they have the most incredible flavor that i have not found with any of their competitors. they are thoughtful with their marinated vegetable toppings which include mushrooms, green beans, scallions, and peanuts. their portion sizes are wonderful, and no matter which one you order, you're always going to have fantastic, comforting spoonfuls of deliciousness. the three stars however, is due to the lack of vegan options. my personal opinion is that in this day and age you must have good vegan/vegetarian options. they advertise vegan and vegetarian options but they are truly meeger. you must offer tofu and vegetable broth at a ramen place if you are trying to appeal to vegans and vegetarians, period. i ordered the shrimp, but honestly, i didn't want to. i normally order fried tofu for my protein which they do not offer. if they had an organic tofu option for protein, a vegetable broth option, and if they were flexible on substituting one broth for another(my husband always prefers beef broth, which they have, but they would not substitute the chicken broth for the beef broth for his soup order), then i would definitely give them five stars in the future! as of now, i don't know if i'll be back. management-please take note!:-)

stay away!!!!stay away!!!!stay away!!!! today, i went to this store and find so so so so many items were expired. so, check the expired before you wanna buy. second, after i check out, i found they charge me more money. and the cashier just return the money, and said it is normal.(plus never say sorry to me) so, i think they always do like this. anyway, i will never go to this store again. warning!!!!! check the expired day!!! check your receipt!!!

i told the lady 6 times i would like three ground beef tacos with one soft !! i went to the window the lady asked again what did you want again ! i said three ground beef tacos and one of them soft !!!  i come home to three all soft tacos !!! i call them back and they want their food back in order for me to get a credit so they can make the order right wtf!!! on three ground beef tacos !!!!  ridiculous and you lost a customer and it will be all over social media this is ridiculous!!!

i'm not from tucson, and to be honest i had pretty low expectations for a boba joint in a city that appears to have low diversity (referring to asians). but this place is amazing. the tea itself is legit. along with the milk. i got a regular chatime milk tea (30% sweetness) and it was the best original milk tea i have had. i'm incredibly surprised it beats all of the milk tea spots i've tried in los angeles. the milk tea at chatime really has the tea flavor that you can tell is high quality. the people behind the counter said they use loose leaf tea to make it which is demonstrated through the delicious flavor.  i highly recommend this place for their milk tea as i can't comment on anything else, but i'll definitely be coming here often when i visit tucson. open earlier please edit (9/16/16): this is super important. they make their own toppings in house. the ginger tea comes from ginger they grate in the back. the banana milk tea comes from real bananas condensed in the back. same with the strawberries, rose, etc. i thought this was ubiquitous to all chatimes but it isn't. i found a chatime in la and was super excited cause i thought they had the same menu as this tucson one. bigmistake. the chatime in la had none. it was all artificial and fake flavorings. since when does tucson beat los angeles in a boba contest?!?!! the tucson chatime that this review is for seriously is amazing. i am in disbelief and disappointed that i only get to go to this chatime four days a year (but twice a day when i'm there). edit (december 2017): sigh. all good things must come to an end. as you've probably read, management has changed. i've gone there several times in 2017 (april, august, october and december) and the drinks have been pitiful each time. they no longer make ingredients fresh, the boba has been stale, and the workers are so unhappy. the staff in 2016 was absolutely amazing and proud of the drinks they made. the current staff must be quickly employees sabotaging chatime because they really don't want to be there. i got my usual ginger milk tea each time i visited and it just isn't the same. today there wasn't even ginger. i'd avoid this place. i think bing's will be my new go to. goodbye once loved chatime. rip.

one star!! just because you didn't make enough chocolate cake! wtf!!!!!!!!  demetrius!!! great!!! he was awesome but who's responsible for desert really make enough!! chocolate, woman's best answer for life!!! get on board!!

soooo sad!! this has been my go to place for the most amazing fettuccine alfredo in tucson - they used to have beautiful, tender noodles bathed in a rich smooth alfredo. my mouth waters as i think of it. we chose to dine there last night and i ordered my standard with grilled chicken--what i got was a gluey hunk of al dente noodles with a dry, grainy alfredo - i almost cried! talked to the waitress and she said they've recently made some changes --noooooo! bring back the old recipe! why fix it if it wasn't broke!!! gonna give it one more try before moving on.

the food here is hands down amazing!! best middle eastern food in town. the reason for 2 stars is because we had the rudest waitress i have ever seen in my life. it was beyond shocking. also, they allow hookah smoking and i have asthma so we had to leave quickly. for those reasons we won't be back, which is such a shame because the food is great.

i usually never get jimmy johns, i prefer jersey mikes. the one time my friend is like hey let's get jimmy johns i'm like aight let's do it! i get my sandwich and damn! your lettuce is old!! it's literally red. that's so gross. i'm really picky with lettuce so this sent me over the edge! never coming back!!!

been waiting 25 minutes for chicken strips and half order of biscuits and gravy  why??  saw drinks being prepared by a server with no gloves adding fruit to drinks with her hands! eww! food finally arrived after 40 minutes, gravy was sweet. we won't be back! the best thing about our visit was the waitress! zazia was excellent, attentive, kind and cheerful!!

sad! just ordered online delivery & didn't have a good situation. no where on their online menu does it say their chicken hero is breaded (thought it was just going to be a plain chicken breast)- ah! i had to pick off the breaded part, which left very little actually chicken. literally the only extras you get are cheese, mayo, tomato, and lettuce. could they not even spare an onion for this 10 dollar sandwich?  10 dollars! yikes! i also ordered wings and their normal buffalo sauce is very sweet- not what you expect from buffalo wings. the worst part was, the house salad, that actually looks like the best thing i received from my order, came with no fork to eat it with! i guess this is fine because i'm so off put by the flavor of the wings that i've lost my appetite. the delivery was prompt-at least! bottomline- super overpriced for what you get & i didn't even get a napkin or a fork

every single time we get delivery from this place they mess up the entire order!  not only do they screw up the pitas themselves, but they leave out items and still try to charge you for them! then when you call eat a pita to complain about your messed up order to the "manager", instead of being apologetic and fixing the problem, he is a total sarcastic jerk about the issue.  from everyone here at umc, say goodbye to our business. i recommend greek house instead! they have the best pitas and they never mess up an order.

will i be back or not?  no, we will not be back this year!  it was a festive place.  packed with people.  the waitress was awesome!!  she was knowledgeable of the menu, wines, etc.  we ordered several tapas, 2 were edible, the rabbit was so salty, it was as if we swallowed the sea!  i ate it because i was hungry and cringed with every bite i took.   we ordered the salmon med rare and it arrived well done!  we ate that too because we figuered they did not know how to cook salmon. the waitress offered for the kitchen to make us new dishes, we refused the offer.  we had already waited so long for our first order but the real reason and truth was; i did not trust the chef!!  we got a shot of sherry for our dissappointment!  as if that corrected the problem!

literally the dirtiest playland and mcdonald's i've ever been to! whoever the owner is they should get their shit together before the place gives everybody hepsie for god sake's! i have never seen so many flies in one building. i wouldn't be shocked if there were piles of crap in the corners there were so many!
